gloss: “Blessed”, one of the two messenger-boys of the goddess ảṯrt
mythical female being defeated by Anat (etym. unc.)
the Powerful One/Valiant One/title of Baal
Gaṯaru/Gašru/eponym of the dead and deified kings
Hayyānu/alt. name of the god kṯr (Kothar)
second component of the double-barrelled divine name yrḫ w ksả, a lunar deity
Naharu/“River”/alternative DN of the god ym
“The Holy One”, epithet of the god ỉl/“The Holy One”, name of one of the messenger-boys of the goddess ảṯrt
Šunama/Shunama/second member of the double-barrelled divine name ṯkmn w šnm, origin unknown
Ṣapānu/Zaphon/the mountain dwelling of bʕl deified
Ṯukamuna/Thukamuna/first element of the double-barrelled DN ṯkmn w šnm, origin unknown
term for the kings of Ugarit
Ugar/one of the two messenger-boys of Baal
alternative (ancient?) name of the god ym
Yaʿibdarru/"(Daughter) of the Wide World"/attribute of ảrṣy, daughter of the god bʕl (etym. unc.)
